meanings.definition: Considered or regarded as being a certain way.
meanings.sent1: The old house was reckoned haunted by the locals.
meanings.sent2: She was reckoned the best singer in the school.
meanings.sent3: The cat reckoned itself the king of the house, lounging on the sofa all day.
meanings.sent4: The storm reckoned the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map reckoned a hidden path through the dense forest.

meanings.sent1: The reckoned cost of the project was within budget.
meanings.sent2: The reckoned time of arrival was 3 p.m.
meanings.sent3: The reckoned weight of the pumpkin turned out to be heavier than expected.
meanings.sent4: The reckoned distance to the next town seemed longer on foot.
meanings.sent5: The reckoned value of the antique vase surprised the auction attendees.
